com.mygdx.game

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
      • com.mygdx.game.GameEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class GameEngine
extends com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
    GameEngine class is the core class that updates the game state graphically and physically every frame. It populates the window with a world, its initial Box2D physics objects, and its camera. It also manages user input.
    Author:
    Sean Aubrey, Gabriel Fountain, Brandon Conn

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        This method updates constantly. Updates graphical state. Updates physical state. Listens for user input. Performs a physics step of the world.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        render in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
        Parameters:
        delta -

      • getDeltaTime

        public static float getDeltaTime()
        Returns Gdx frame time.
        Returns:
        difference in time between frames.

      • updateGraphics

        private void updateGraphics()

      • flashRed

        public void flashRed()
        Sets the flashRed bool to true in order to briefly color the screen red to indicate that the player has taken damage.

      • checkClick

        private void checkClick()
        Updates a time accumulator with the time between frames and tells Player to fire a projectile if the mouse button clicked or held down, or shotgun projectiles if space is pressed. ESC pauses the game.

      • manageBodies

        private void manageBodies()
        Retrieves all bodies in the world and bodies to be deleted to delete those that match. Also updates each body's graphical position.

      • checkMovement

        private void checkMovement()
        Determines which directional keys are pressed, WASD, to update player movement.

      • scale

        public static float scale(float val)
        Scales pixel dimensions to the camera's viewport size so that physical object dimensions can be declared in units of meters to function correctly within Box2D. In other words, rather than scaling the objects to the window size, we scale the window size to the object.
        Parameters:
        val - window dimension
        Returns:
        viewport dimension

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        Adjusts camera view to new window dimensions.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        resize in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
        Parameters:

        height - window height.
